metadata.title: CVE-2024-35849 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: btrfs:fix information leak in btrfs_ioctl_logical_to_ino() Syzbot reported thefollowing information leak for in btrfs_ioctl_logical_to_ino(): BUG: KMSAN:kernel-infoleak in instrument_copy_to_user include/linux/instrumented.h:114[inline] BUG: KMSAN: kernel-infoleak in _copy_to_user+0xbc/0x110lib/usercopy.c:40 instrument_copy_to_user include/linux/instrumented.h:114[inline] _copy_to_user+0xbc/0x110 lib/usercopy.c:40 copy_to_userinclude/linux/uaccess.h:191 [inline] btrfs_ioctl_logical_to_ino+0x440/0x750fs/btrfs/ioctl.c:3499 btrfs_ioctl+0x714/0x1260 vfs_ioctl fs/ioctl.c:51[inline] __do_sys_ioctl fs/ioctl.c:904 [inline] __se_sys_ioctl+0x261/0x450fs/ioctl.c:890 __x64_sys_ioctl+0x96/0xe0 fs/ioctl.c:890x64_sys_call+0x1883/0x3b50 arch/x86/include/generated/asm/syscalls_64.h:17do_syscall_x64 arch/x86/entry/common.c:52 [inline] do_syscall_64+0xcf/0x1e0arch/x86/entry/common.c:83 entry_SYSCALL_64_after_hwframe+0x77/0x7f Uninitwas created at: __kmalloc_large_node+0x231/0x370 mm/slub.c:3921__do_kmalloc_node mm/slub.c:3954 [inline] __kmalloc_node+0xb07/0x1060mm/slub.c:3973 kmalloc_node include/linux/slab.h:648 [inline]kvmalloc_node+0xc0/0x2d0 mm/util.c:634 kvmalloc include/linux/slab.h:766[inline] init_data_container+0x49/0x1e0 fs/btrfs/backref.c:2779btrfs_ioctl_logical_to_ino+0x17c/0x750 fs/btrfs/ioctl.c:3480btrfs_ioctl+0x714/0x1260 vfs_ioctl fs/ioctl.c:51 [inline] __do_sys_ioctlfs/ioctl.c:904 [inline] __se_sys_ioctl+0x261/0x450 fs/ioctl.c:890__x64_sys_ioctl+0x96/0xe0 fs/ioctl.c:890 x64_sys_call+0x1883/0x3b50arch/x86/include/generated/asm/syscalls_64.h:17 do_syscall_x64arch/x86/entry/common.c:52 [inline] do_syscall_64+0xcf/0x1e0arch/x86/entry/common.c:83 entry_SYSCALL_64_after_hwframe+0x77/0x7f Bytes40-65535 of 65536 are uninitialized Memory access of size 65536 starts atffff888045a40000 This happens, because we're copying a 'structbtrfs_data_container' back to user-space. This btrfs_data_container isallocated in 'init_data_container()' via kvmalloc(), which does notzero-fill the memory. Fix this by using kvzalloc() which zeroes out thememory on allocation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-35849` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.8.0-40-generic - 6.8.0-40.40
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-40-generic - 6.8.0-40.40
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-40-generic-64k - 6.8.0-40.40
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1013-aws - 6.8.0-1013.14
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1012-azure - 6.8.0-1012.14
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1012-gcp - 6.8.0-1012.13
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1008-gke - 6.8.0-1008.11
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1010-ibm - 6.8.0-1010.10
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-40-lowlatency - 6.8.0-40.40.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-40-lowlatency-64k - 6.8.0-40.40.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1010-oracle - 6.8.0-1010.10
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1010-oracle-64k - 6.8.0-1010.10
No subscription required

linux-image-6.8.0-1009-raspi - 6.8.0-1009.10
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1010-oem - 6.8.0-1010.10
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-intel - 6.8.0-1009.16
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-40.40').
linux-aws package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-1013.14').
linux-azure package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-1012.14').
linux-gcp package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-1012.13').
linux-gke package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-1008.11').
linux-ibm package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-1010.10').
linux-lowlatency package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-40.40.1').
linux-oracle package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-1010.10').
linux-raspi package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-1009.10').
linux-oem-6.8 package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-1010.10').
linux-intel package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-1009.16').
linux-raspi-realtime package in noble is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '6.8.0-2008.8').
linux-realtime package in noble is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '6.8.1-1006.6').
